messages.subject: the dreaded "what to do for portfolio review" question for unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: I absolutely love these groups (sorry for the double posting but wanted to make sure I get all the help I can ;-) ) and have learned so much since switching
messages.messageBody:
I absolutely love these groups (sorry for the double posting but wanted
to make sure I get all the help I can ;-) ) and have learned so much
since "switching over to the dark side"...just teasing...he he he.
Anyway, I am still very unsure about how to present a portfolio for my
review. I've read Sandra Dodd's site on curriculum and found it very
useful except for showing something tangible come review day. Last
review was a breeze; here's workbook a, here's workbook b, bla bla
bla. I know he's continuing to use his knowledge of mathematical
principals, applying them in everyday life and understanding them quite
well I might add - better than the boring workbook days - but how do I
show his progress? handwriting too...gone are the daily copy work
lessons we used to do and he hasn't volunteered to write anything yet.
(BTW - he'll be 8 next year)

Also -advice wanted from any fellow West Virginians who have had
experience with unschooler friendly portfolio reviewers or does everyone
test?

Thanks in advance to all of you wonderful contributors!
Amy in WV
